intro: Oreocharis curvituba, commonly known as the twisted-tube oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to moist, shaded environments. Oreocharis curvituba is noted for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
